commit.message:
GEODE-8670: ReconnectDUnitTest is hiding a NullPointerException

1. Fixed all of the IgnorableException problems in ReconnectDUnitTest
2. Modified InternalLocator to avoid throwing a NullPointerException and
   added a test for this change

nodes.bodyText: I'm not saying this test is invalid, but it doesn't validate the fix below in InternalLocator i.e. if one comments out that code the test still passes...

commit.message:
fixing invalid test - had to move it to a new class to use SystemOutRule

the rule wasn't working for some reason when I added it to
InternalLocatorIntegrationTest
removed use of SystemOutRule, which wasn't working in Stress tests

nodes.bodyText: Now that the (broken) regexp is no longer hiding exceptions, and you've explicitly added expectations for all of them, this test serves a good documentation for these exceptions and their role in reconnect.

I assume this is done to speed up the test. I like it!
But shouldn't we be restoring the system property after the test runs? I believe we have a JUnit rule for that?
My read of InternalLocator is that it's ok to provide null log writers to the constructor ✓
I guess we had the reconnect cases covered (in the DUnit test) and this new test is for the no-reconnect case ✓
